SEARCH
Package gw.api.util

Class DateUtil

java.lang.Object
gw.api.util.DateUtil
public class DateUtil extends Object
Provides date manipulation and calculation utilities.

    • daysBetween

      public static int daysBetween(Date date1, Date date2)
      Returns number of days between two dates. Note that this method returns an absolute value, i.e., the order of the arguments does not matter. This is as opposed to differenceInDays(java.util.Date, java.util.Date), which returns a true difference.
      Parameters:
      date1 -
      date2 -
      Returns:
      The number of days between the two dates. The number is the absolute value of the difference in days.

    • differenceInDays

      public static int differenceInDays(Date dateStart, Date dateEnd)
      Returns the difference between dateEnd at midnight and dateStart at midnight, in days.
      Parameters:
      dateStart - The start date.
      dateEnd - The end date.
      Returns:
      The difference between dateEnd and dateStart, in days. The result is positive if dateStart comes before dateEnd (ignoring time); negative if dateStart comes after dateEnd (ignoring time); zero if the two dates are the same (ignoring time)

    • compareIgnoreTime

      public static int compareIgnoreTime(Date date1, Date date2)
      Compares only the date components of two dates, the time component is ignored.
      Parameters:
      date1 - The date.
      date2 - The date to compare against.
      Returns:
      The value 0 if date1 equals date; a value less than 0 if date1 is less than date2; and a value greater than 0 if date1 is greater than date2.

    • addMinutes

      public static Date addMinutes(Date date, int iMinutes)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of minutes to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 minutes from the current time of the date, you can achieve it by calling: addMinutes( date, -5 ).
      Parameters:
      date - The time.
      iMinutes - The amount of minutes to add.
      Returns:
      A new date with the minutes added.

    • addSeconds

      public static Date addSeconds(Date date, int iSeconds)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of seconds to the given date.
      Parameters:
      date - The time.
      iSeconds - The amount of seconds to add.
      Returns:
      A new date with the seconds added.

    • addHours

      public static Date addHours(Date date, int iHours)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of hours to the given date. For example, to subtract 5 hours from the current date, you can achieve it by calling: addHours( date, -5 ).
      Parameters:
      date - The time.
      iHours - The amount of hours to add.
      Returns:
      A new date with the hours added.

    • addDays

      public static Date addDays(Date date, int iDays)

      Parameters:
      date - The time.
      iDays - The amount of days to add.
      Returns:
      A new date with the days added.

    • addWeeks

      Parameters:
      date - The time.
      iWeeks - The amount of weeks to add.
      Returns:
      A new date with the weeks added.

    • trimToMidnight

      public static Date trimToMidnight(Date date)
      Trim the given date to midnight. That is to say, set days, hours, minutes, seconds, and millis to zero.
      Parameters:
      date - the date to trim.
      Returns:
      a Date without any time component.

    • mergeDateAndTime

      public static Date mergeDateAndTime(Date dateSource, Date timeSource)
      Merges the date component of dateSource with the time component of timeSource.
      Parameters:
      dateSource - the day (MM/dd/yyyy) to merge; time part is ignored.
      timeSource - the time (hh:mm:ss.SSS) to merge; date part is ignored.
      Returns:
      a new Date containing the date componenent of dateSource combined with the time component of timeSource.

    • format

      public static String format(Date date, String dateComponent, String timeComponent)
      Deprecated.
      Please call Libraries.java.lang.String.formatDate() and/or Libraries.java.lang.String.formatTime() instead.
      Converts a Date to a String. Allowable values for dateComponent and timeComponent are "long", "medium", "short".

    • getYearFromString

      public static String getYearFromString(String yearString)
      Get the year from a string of digits. Always returns a four-digit year. Will convert a two-digit year into a four-digit year. Two digit years are resolved using the TwoDigitYearThreshold configuration parameter.
      Parameters:
      yearString - java.lang.String representation of a year, either two digits or four digits.
      Returns:
      The four-digit representation of a year. Returns null if the input java.lang.String was invalid.

    • getDayOfWeekName

      public static String getDayOfWeekName(Date date)
      Get the day of week name.
      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      Returns:
      The name of the day in the week e.g., "Monday".

    • getMonthName

      public static String getMonthName(int month)
      Gets the name of the given month.
      Parameters:
      month - the 1-based month value. I.e., January is 1, February is 2, etc.

    • getBusinessDaysAsBooleanArray

      public static boolean[] getBusinessDaysAsBooleanArray(Object zoneTag)
      Return an array seven of booleans where each boolean indicates whether the corresponding day is considered a business day. The array is laid out like so:

      Parameters:
      zoneTag - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.


      [Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday]

    • isBusinessDay

      public static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, HolidayTagCode tag, Object businessWeekZone)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day
      Parameters:
      date - The date
      tag - The holiday tag code
      businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
      Returns:
      True if the date is a business day with respect to the holiday tag code

    • isBusinessDay

      public static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, HolidayTagCode tag)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day. The default business week zone will be used.
      Parameters:
      date - The date
      tag - The holiday tag code
      Returns:
      True if the date is a business day with respect to the holiday tag code

    • isBusinessDay

      public static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, Zone location)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day
      Parameters:
      date - The date
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      True if the date is a business day with respect to the location

    • isBusinessDay

      public static boolean isBusinessDay(Date date, Address location)
      Returns true if the date in question is a business day
      Parameters:
      date - The date
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      True if the date is a business day with respect to the location

    • getConfiguredHolidays

      public static Date[] getConfiguredHolidays()
      Return the days configured to be holidays for the system.
      Returns:
      An array of the dates configured to be holidays under the tag code HolidayTagCode.TC_GENERAL.

    • getConfiguredHolidays

      public static Date[] getConfiguredHolidays(HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Return the days configured to be holidays under a certain holiday tag code.
      Parameters:
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      Returns:
      An array of the dates configured to be holidays under the given tag code.

    • getConfiguredHolidays

      public static Date[] getConfiguredHolidays(Zone location)
      Return the days configured to be holidays for a certain location.
      Parameters:
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      An array of the dates configured to be holidays for the given location.

    • addBusinessDays

      public static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays)
      Adds the specified (signed) amount of business days to the given date. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iDays - The number of business days added.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business days added.

    • addBusinessDays

      public static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iDays - The number of business days to add.
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business days added.

    • addBusinessDays

      public static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iDays - The number of business days to add.
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business days added.

    • addBusinessDays

      public static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, Zone location)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iDays - The number of business days to add.
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business days added.

    • addBusinessDays

      public static Date addBusinessDays(Date date, int iDays, Address location)
      Adds the specified (signed) number of business days to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of the given date is preserved in the result.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iDays - The number of business days to add.
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business days added.

    • addBusinessHours

      public static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iHours - The number of business hours to add.
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business hours added.

    • addBusinessHours

      public static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iHours - The number of business hours to add.
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business hours added.

    • addBusinessHours

      public static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, Zone location)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iHours - The number of business hours to add.
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business hours added.

    • addBusinessHours

      public static Date addBusinessHours(Date date, int iHours, Address location)
      Adds the specified signed number of business hours to the given date, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      date - The date.
      iHours - The number of business hours to add.
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      A new date with the business hours added.

    • businessDaysBetween

      public static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessDaysBetween

      public static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessDaysBetween

      public static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, Zone location)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessDaysBetween

      public static int businessDaysBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, Address location)
      Calculates the difference in business days between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted. The time of day of each given date is ignored.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessHoursBetween

      public static int businessHoursBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, HolidayTagCode tagCode)
      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production. The default business week zone will be used.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessHoursBetween

      public static int businessHoursBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, HolidayTagCode tagCode, Object businessWeekZone)
      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a holiday tag code which will determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      tagCode - The holiday tag code.
      businessWeekZone - Either a zone or an address indicating which businessWeek to fetch. If null is passed in, it will use the default one.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessHoursBetween

      public static int businessHoursBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, Zone location)
      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • businessHoursBetween

      public static int businessHoursBetween(Date fromDate, Date toDate, Address location)
      Calculates the difference in business hours between two dates, based on a location which may determine which holiday schedule is consulted.

      Note that the Studio Gosu Tester does not have access to the real Holiday configuration, so results in the Tester may not match those in production.

      Parameters:
      fromDate - The start date (the right operand in the subtraction).
      toDate - The end date (the left operand in the subtraction).
      location - The location.
      Returns:
      The number of business days between the two dates. If toDate is later than fromDate, this will be a positive number, and vice versa.

    • getBusinessWeekEnd

      public static int getBusinessWeekEnd()
      Return the business day end as an integer. The integers are mapped as follows:

      • 0 indicates no end of business week was configured
      • 1 indicates Sunday
      • 2 indicates Monday
      • 3 indicates Tuesday
      • 4 indicates Wednesday
      • 5 indicates Thursday
      • 6 indicates Friday
      • 7 indicates Saturday

      As specified by Calendar.SUNDAY, etc.

    • getBusinessDayStart

      public static Date getBusinessDayStart()
      Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the start of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

      NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.

    • getBusinessDayEnd

      public static Date getBusinessDayEnd()
      Return a date whose hour, minute and second fields are set to the end of the business day, as configured in config.xml.

      NOTE: No guarantees are made about any other fields on this date object, and they should NOT be accessed.

    • verifyDateOnOrAfterToday

      public static Boolean verifyDateOnOrAfterToday(Date date)
      Used to validate whether the date selected is on or after today. Returns null if date is null.
      Parameters:
      date - the date to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the given date is equal to or later than the start of day today.

    • createDateInstance

      public static Date createDateInstance(int month, int day, int year)
      Creates a new Date instance initialized to the specified month, day and year.
      Parameters:
      month - month
      day - day
      year - year
      Returns:
      a Date.

    • formatAsJapaneseImperialDate

      public static String formatAsJapaneseImperialDate(Date date, DateTimeFormat formatType, boolean withTime)
      If Japanese Imperial Calendar is available, converts date to an output string in Japanese Imperial Calendar format
      Parameters:
      date - the Date to convert to a String
      formatType - the format of the output, if none is specified then "SHORT" is assumed
      withTime - whether to output the time part of the date
      Returns:
      date in Japanese Imperial Calendar format, if Japanese Imperial Calendar is available

    • getWorker

      public static PublicBusinessCalendarWorker getWorker()
      Equivalent to calling getWorker(HolidayTagCode.TC_GENERAL.get()).
      Returns:
      a BusinessCalendarWorker for the TC_GENERAL tag.

    • getWorker

      public static PublicBusinessCalendarWorker getWorker(Zone zone)
      Parameters:
      zone - the Zone
      Returns:
      a BusinessCalendarWorker for the zone

    • getWorker

      public static PublicBusinessCalendarWorker getWorker(Address address)
      Parameters:
      address - the Address
      Returns:
      a BusinessCalendarWorker for the address.
